snippet.title: Helen Kennedy
snippet.description: Kennedy, Helen Was reunited with her husband Harry on February 1, 2014. Loving mother of Edward Kennedy, Laura (Tim) Coralline, the late JoAnn Kennedy-Duran and the late Richard Kennedy. Proud grandmother of Sandra (Chuck) Barsky, Nancy Duran, Edward Kennedy Jr., Ericka (Michael) Kennedy-Burzynski, Brian (Stacy) Kennedy, Erin

snippet.title: Sen. Edward M. Kennedy dies at age 77
snippet.description: Sen. Edward M. Kennedy, the liberal lion of the Senate and haunted bearer of the Camelot torch after two of his brothers fell to assassins' bullets, has died after battling a brain tumor. He was 77.

snippet.title: Edward M. (Ted) Kennedy | 1932 – 2009 | Last of a political dynasty
snippet.description: Edward Kennedy, a liberal Democrat, served in the Senate during 10 presidential administrations, including that of his brother John. When he died, Kennedy was the third-longest serving senator in history, at 46 years and nine months. Read more: Senator recalled fondly by state politicians

snippet.title: Wisconsin politicians react to death of Sen. Kennedy
snippet.description: Following are public statements released Wednesday by Wisconsin politicians in the wake of the death of U.S. Sen. Edward Kennedy: Gov. Jim Doyle U.S. Sen. Russ Feingold U.S.

snippet.title: Ted Kennedy
snippet.description: After nearly 50 years serving his country in the Senate, Edward Kennedy has died . May his soul, and the souls of all the faithful departed, through the mercy of God rest in peace. Also: WSJ's James Taranto on Kennedy's idealism,

snippet.title: Mass. Sen. Edward M. Kennedy dies at age 77 after battle with brain tumor
snippet.description: Sen. Edward M. Kennedy, the liberal lion of the Senate and haunted bearer of the Camelot torch after two of his brothers fell to assassins' bullets, has died after battling a brain tumor. He was 77. Boston - Sen. Edward M. Kennedy, the liberal lion of the Senate

snippet.title: Schenkkan, O'Brien win award honoring Sen. Kennedy
snippet.description: NEW YORK (AP) Dan O'Brien's "The Body of an American" and Robert Schenkkan's "All the Way" have been named the inaugural winners of a theater award honoring the late U.S. Sen. Edward Kennedy. Columbia University on Friday said the playwrights will share the award and $100,000, one of

snippet.title: In epic upset, GOP's Brown wins Massachusetts Senate race
snippet.description: In an epic upset in liberal Massachusetts, Republican Scott Brown rode a wave of voter anger to win the U.S. Senate seat held by the late Edward M. Kennedy for nearly half a century, leaving President Barack Obama's health care overhaul in doubt and marring the end of his first
